website_summaries.verdict: AtGames' newest Sega Genesis retro console adds HDMI and improved wireless controllers, and even plays original cartridge games, but it ain't no NES Classic.
pros: The Sega Genesis Flashback has wireless controllers, save game slots and it works with HDTVs
It comes with dozens of preinstalled games, and even works with original Genesis controllers and old game cartridges
cons: Audio and video quality often falls short of the original, and gameplay can get laggy
28 of the 85 games are random crapware

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE! Only demos of Sonic 1 & 2
customer_reviews.text: First, one of the controllers won’t work out of the box. Second, I tried to play Sonic 1 and 2 (the only reason I bought this console) and all it allows me to do is watch demos of levels being played without me touching any buttons. The controller works in that I am allowed to pick which game to play, but once I hit play none of my controller keys work and the demo videos just keep playing. It can’t be me doing something wrong as I chose Sonic and Knuckles the same way and it actually allows me to play that one. Buyer beware!
